GlossaryCacheEntry.Definition: A graphical representation of each Element in four quadrants based on Score and Impact on Satisfaction. Implacts are graphed on the x-acis and Element Scores are graphed on the y-axis.
An open ended question, i.e., a question which is expected to be answered with a narrative as opposed to a static yes/no, true/false, or 0-10 rating.
The likelihood of site visitors to exhibit, or exhibit more often, a certain action as a result of a positive experience, such as returning to or referring others to a website, store, or call center.

An average of scores collected from five or more similar organizations to be used as a standard for comparing a score against peers or competitors. Benchmark data also includes top scores for comparison to best-in-class.

A collection of widgets called Tiles, which display a rating based on selected data types, such as demographics, environment, or customer satisfaction. There can be any number of tiles in a dashboard, and any number of dashboards.

Custom question data which is graphically displayed in a hierarchical form. A score is branched for each selected question with each branch representing a selected response. For example, the question of Age is selected for a score, with the four youngest age groups selected. The result is a Journey Tree with four branches with scores and n Counts for each age. If another question is added with three answers selected, each of the four Age branches is divided into three, and so on.
Two to five scores displayed over a selected time span in a line chart. This tile illustrates how changes in one score may or may not impact other scores.
To display data in greater granularity, i.e., to view the details of which data is comprised of.
